Repeating from last thread:

I'm not even mad or trying to be spiteful, but for the next OP remove Where Kitsune Wait (Ch. 14) from the OP. At this point he is just bumping off other writers who willing interactive with the thread and come here regularly enough looking for feedback. We should prioritize writers that update in the thread so they can get feedback and exposure here.

It's not about "punishing" a writer, rather it's about prioritizing newer and active artists. The OP should reflect writers actively looking for an audience, discussion and feedback here. The point of the OP is that ANYBODY can post something here and get it in the OP within reason, putting story updates that were not even submitted here by the author shows favoritism and can be quite discouraging for lurkers and writers who have been following threads just to see a story come out of nowhere and bump off there story that they submitted to the thread.

Anonymous Sun 18 Jul 2021 00:42:44 No.40245625 Report
Quoted By: >>40245862
>>40245189
I think it's a perfectly sound argument. It's not like it makes it impossible to discuss the story in here or anything, as there has been plenty of discussion about other hmofa content before. But it's kind of weird to give special attention to well known creators who aren't engaging with the thread anymore. This isn't an aggregate thread, after all. It's an active thread with active creators, and as such is intended to be the hub of activity for our content. Maybe it's not too much effort for two big names with languid updating regimes, but say we also extend that favor to Snekguy. He writes around 2000 words a day, and consequently updates his stories in a similar timeframe. Are we going to bump him to the top of the list every day because of this, while no-one who reads his work here would even have their compliments or questions be seen by him? No, we wouldn't. Ultimately it's the writer's own responsibility to make a small post here that their story has been updated. If they no longer want to do that, fine, but we shouldn't feel obliged to perform fan labor that won't be extended to smaller writers.

And I don't know what's up otherwise. Maybe he doesn't like the thread anymore, maybe he just pushed the story on SoFurry because it's easy as pie and making a post here is the kind of "I'll do it later" thing that can grow beyond a few days. If we know a writer is banned or otherwise indisposed it's a courtesy to include them in the update anyway. But if such unusual circumstances aren't present, I'd say regular rules apply.

DecoFox !!l3JhOw/FeSb Sun 18 Jul 2021 01:33:10 No.40246709 Report
Quoted By: >>40247582 >>40247650
>limiting OP to local posts
I can see the logic, but I don't see it helping. I've been here since < thread 50 and the OP just doesn't have that much impact on views anymore. It hasn't since thread 200 or so. Throughput is simply too high for most people to make reading choices based on the OP. Back in the day I'd go through it systematically reading most everything, but back then there were less than 20 active stories, and most weren't long. You would have to treat this shit as a full time job to keep up with the OP now.

>People will still make new choices based on the OP
Maybe a couple, but I can tell you the numbers are almost negligible. When I post an update, there is a considerable initial view spike for the thread in which I posted or the immediate following if I posted late, but very little difference between the rate at which new views are obtained between when that update is or isn't in the OP. I might get one or two extra views a week from a story sitting in the OP. The absence of one or two outside posts in the OP will make little to no difference in view metrics for the remainder. Buzz in the thread is the only thing that does it. It's certainly how I pick stories.

>/hmofa/ wasn't designed as an aggregator
I won't pretend to know the motivations of the original, day-one OP, but Snekguy and a couple other Reddit stories have been update-listed here pretty much as long as the thread has been around. I could see the need for a change if the OP became replete with third-party stories to the exclusion of domestic stories, but until then it's just convenient to have them.

I'm in a weird place with this philosophy. Two stories I've made received enough praise that it set a fire under my ass and made me churn out sequels. Said sequels got a mere fraction of the readership, likes/faves/etc and, as I usually do, I just went back to my rotation out of the assumption that they just werent as good for that very reason. Of course the lack of overall feedback also didn't help.
I'm just thankful that I'm not a big enough name that I'd feel guilty about not uploading as frequently as some of the better, more consistent writers out there. But at the same time, both those sequels were made in a far shorter time because of how enthusiastic I was in creating more because of that initial success.
I don't know if I'll ever settle on a final pace of writing. I guess I'll see when I upload the next two story updates (one is a fairly unknown follow up, the other is one of my more popular series') and see if anything happens.
